hi guys! I have a stupid issue: I’m trying to filter a matrix (MNIST dataset), and discard any letters other than 1, 2. I’ve written a function that does that, but it returns an arrays of arrays, that I’m then struggling to convert back into a matrix (I’ve looked up a couple of examples, but none of them seem to work in this specific case, maybe I’m messing up something?), so MLJ.jl to accept it (I’m trying to use a logistic classifier - which I know is not ideal, but I’ve got this as a task).
Does anyone have any idea how I could move forward? Are there any best practices to filter on a matrix on a single dimension?

Thank you :slightly_smiling_face:
```using Pkg
Pkg.add(["MLDatasets", "MLJ", "Images", "ImageShow", "MLJLinearModels", "CategoricalArrays"])
using MLDatasets, MLJ, Images, ImageShow, MLJLinearModels, CategoricalArrays
Logistic = @load LogisticClassifier pkg=MLJLinearModels

train_x, train_y = MNIST.traindata()
test_x,  test_y  = MNIST.testdata()

train_x = reshape(train_x, (28*28, size(train_x)[3]))
test_x = reshape(test_x, (28*28, size(test_x)[3]))


function filter_dataset(x, y, predicate::Function)
    filtered_x = []
    filtered_y = []
    for (index, label) in enumerate(y)
        if predicate(label)
            push!(filtered_x, x[:, index])
            push!(filtered_y, label)
        end
    end
    return filtered_x, filtered_y
end

train_x, train_y = filter_dataset(train_x, train_y, label -> label == 1 || label == 2)
test_x, test_y = filter_dataset(test_x, test_y, label -> label == 1 || label == 2)

train_x = permutedims(reshape(hcat(train_x...), (length(train_x[1]), length(train_x)))) #trying to convect it into a matrix, but failing...

logistic_model = Logistic()
logistic = machine(logistic_model, scitype(train_x), CategoricalArray(train_y))
# this throws an error on incompatible data - I'm passing in an array of arrays, instead of a matrix

fit!(logistic, verbosity=2)

scitype(train_x)

# IRIS example dataset - this works well
iris_X, iris_y = @load_iris
iris_X
iris_y
logistic = machine(logistic_model, iris_X, iris_y)
fit!(logistic, verbosity=2)```
